thread.title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches Big Three boys soccer title
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches Big Three boys soccer title

author: Staff reports
title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Brockton clinches Big Three boys soccer title
text: Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 1:20 AM Updated at 1:24 AM Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 1:20 AM Updated at 1:24 AM It was close, but in the end, the result yielded a title for the Brockton High boys soccer teams. The Boxers defeated Durfee, 1-0, on Thursday behind a goal from Lucas Spinola and clinched the Big Three championship for Brockton (12-0-2, 2-0-1 in the Big Three). The Boxers weren’t able to convert many offensive chances, but one goal was enough along with some stellar defense. Cristiano Martins, Bruno Martins, Kevin Correia and Ardley Docanto played well defensively to stymie the Hilltoppers’ attack. Elsewhere in high school action: BOYS SOCCER Oliver Ames 2, Foxboro 2: The Warriors tied it with 4:30 left in regulation. The Tigers received two goals from Thomas McCormick. GIRLS SOCCER Whitman-Hanson 4, Plymouth North 0: The Panthers (10-0) did all their scoring in the first half with Alexis Fruzzetti (one assist), Lauren Bonavita (two assists), Eve Montgomery, and Kat O’Kane each scoring a goal. Lindsay Anderson, Sammi Smith and Taylor Kofton all played strong in the midfield and the defense helped secure the Panthers’ seventh shutout this season. West Bridgewater 6, Westport 0: Addison Climo, Olivia Arce, Emily Yeo, Olivia Church, Connor McCarthy each scored for the Wildcats (8-5). Abington 7, Holbrook 0: The Green Wave had six different goal scorers with Marissa Golden leading the way with two tallies. Madison Grafton, Nicole Marella (assist), Jenny Worden, Emily Duchaney and Lauren Nelligan all found the back of the net. Alexis LaPointe had two assists, while Makayla Zulon, Madison O’Connell and Carly Goldberg had one helper each. Casey Strobel picked up a shutout in her first varsity game. VOLLEYBALL Whitman-Hanson 3, Plymouth North 0: The Panthers (10-4) qualified for the postseason tournament with a 25-14, 25-18 and 25-20 win. Sophie O’Brien and Chiara Cassiano both had eight kills in the win, while teammate Halle Julian had four blocks. Allie Spyropoulos contributed with strong serving. Cardinal Spellman 3, Austin Prep 0: The Cardinals (12-3) swept the Cougars, 25-21, 25-5 and 25-19. Katherine Carrel led the way with 14 service points, 12 kills and two aces. Julia Maker (five service points, three kills, two aces) and Emma Sexton (10 service points) contributed to the win. FIELD HOCKEY East Bridgewater 2, Norwell 0: Abby Gatanti scored both goals for the Vikings with assists coming from Katy Czarniak and Emma Perry. Senior captain Meagan Kelly held down the back end as the defense allowed the Clippers only five shots. GOLF Oliver Ames captures Hockomock title: The Tigers (17-0) came in first at the Hockomock Championships at the Crestwood Country Club in Rehoboth by having the top three finishers. Steven Tasho placed first with a 72, while Jack Green shot a 73 and Brian Lambert turned in a 76. Page 2 of 2 - West Bridgewater finishes fourth at MAC Championships: Eighth-grader Tucker Gullbrants was the medalist of the match, shooting a 2-over 74 for the Wildcats (8-4). Junior Jack Roy also performed well, finishing with a 78. Cardinal Spellman 178, Falmouth 156: Derik Duarte shot a 1-under 35 for the Cardinals (5-12) and teammate James Tyer turned in a 1-over 37. Bridgewater-Raynham 27.5, East Bridgewater 17.5; Bridgewater-Raynham 244, Durfee 299: The Trojans (12-2) split into two matches to finish up regular season play before the MIAA-sanctioned deadline and picked up two wins. Against the Vikings, Ryan Koczela led the way with a 1-under 33, while Dylan Smith turned in a 35 and Just Lavoie shot a 36. Against the Hilltoppers, Connor Anderson pulled off a 1-under for B-R, while John Stork shot a 40 and Ben Williams carded a 41. BOYS CROSS COUNTRY Whitman-Hanson 25, Quincy/North Quincy 36: Jimmy Cannon (17:07) and Peter Saccoach (17:48) finished first and second overall for the Presidents, but the Panthers (6-0) placed the next eight runners to clinch the win. Junior captain Lukas Moscoso came in third with a time of 18:03, while sophomore Jack Ryan (18:11), senior captain Sam Evans (18:53), sophomore Andrew Newman (18:55) and junior Chris Kenney (18:59) followed in order. Patrick Duffey (19:01), Bryce Pulkinen (19:02) and Jayson Keenan (19:04) rounded out the top performers for the Panthers. GIRLS CROSS COUNTRY Whitman-Hanson 19, Quincy/North Quincy 42: Senior captain Samantha Coletti won the race for the Panthers (5-1), covering the 5K course in 19:34. Senior captain Abbie Newman (21:38) finished third and sophomore Nicole Norve (21:38) placed fourth in the win. Sophomores Lillian Perkins-Reisdorf (23:12) and Julia Cosgrave (23:30) came in fifth and sixth, respectively, for Whitman-Hanson. By Staff reports
